designScenario.name: Leading Edge Device System
designScenario.description: The Leading Edge Device System (LEDS) manages the deployment and retraction of leading-edge aerodynamic surfaces (e.g., slats, Krueger flaps) to optimize wing camber and lift during takeoff, landing, and high-angle-of-attack maneuvers. It ensures synchronized actuation, load distribution, and fail-safe operation under extreme aerodynamic forces. The system integrates with flight control computers and hydraulic/pneumatic actuators to dynamically adjust leading-edge geometry, enhancing stall resistance and maneuverability while maintaining structural integrity.

details.description: Deploy/retract slats and Krueger flaps in response to flight phase (takeoff, cruise, landing) via commanded positions from the Flight Control System.
Maintain symmetrical deflection across wings to prevent asymmetric lift-induced roll/yaw instability.
Achieve full deployment/retraction within 3 seconds of command initiation at maximum aerodynamic load.
Maintain positional accuracy of ±0.2° during continuous adjustments.
Implement dual hydraulic actuators with mechanical backups to prevent jamming or over-travel.
Auto-retract to neutral position upon loss of hydraulic pressure or sensor fault detection.
Design for ≥50,000 actuation cycles without degradation in positional accuracy or response time.
Use self-lubricating bearings and erosion-resistant coatings to minimize maintenance intervals.

systemComponents.name: Slats Assembly
systemComponents.description: Primary aerodynamic surfaces mounted on the wing leading edge, extending forward to increase wing area and camber for high-lift configurations.

subComponents.name: Fixed Slat Segment
subComponents.description: Rigid slat section providing continuous lift augmentation when deployed.

subComponents.name: Deployable Slat Track
subComponents.description: Guided rail system enabling slat extension/retraction with minimal friction.

systemComponents.name: Actuation Mechanism
systemComponents.description: Hydraulic/pneumatic system converting control signals into linear/rotational motion for slat deployment.

subComponents.name: Primary Hydraulic Actuator
subComponents.description: High-pressure piston-driven actuator for primary slat movement.

subComponents.name: Backup Ball Screw Actuator
subComponents.description: Electro-mechanical backup actuator engaged during hydraulic system failure.

systemComponents.name: Control Module
systemComponents.description: Embedded controller processing flight control commands and monitoring slat position feedback.

subComponents.name: Slat Control Computer (SCC)
subComponents.description: Dual-channel computer validating commands against aircraft airspeed and attitude data.

subComponents.name: CAN Bus Interface
subComponents.description: Communication interface for integration with Flight Control System networks.

systemComponents.name: Position Sensors
systemComponents.description: Redundant sensors providing real-time slat deflection angle and actuator force measurements.

subComponents.name: Linear Variable Differential Transformer (LVDT)
subComponents.description: Primary sensor measuring slat track displacement with 0.1mm resolution.

subComponents.name: Strain Gauge Array
subComponents.description: Monitors structural loads on slat tracks to prevent overstress conditions.

relationships.description: The Flight Surfaces system aggregates the Leading Edge Device System as a specialized subsystem for leading-edge aerodynamic control.
LEDS depends on hydraulic pressure and electrical signals from the Actuator Control Module to drive slat actuators.
LEDS exclusively owns and manages the Slats Assembly's operational lifecycle.
The Control Module uses continuous feedback from Position Sensors to implement closed-loop slat positioning.

attributes.name: actuationSpeed
attributes.description: Maximum allowable latency between control signal reception and initiation of slat movement.

attributes.name: deploymentAccuracy
attributes.description: Tolerable angular deviation from commanded slat position during steady-state operation.

attributes.name: loadCapacity
attributes.value: Withstand 2500 MPa dynamic pressure at full extension
attributes.description: Structural load-bearing capacity of deployed slats under maximum airspeed.

attributes.name: temperatureRange
attributes.description: Operating and storage temperature limits for slat actuators and sensors.

attributes.name: cycleLife
attributes.description: Minimum guaranteed actuation cycles before component replacement.

comments.body: Manages leading edge device deployment for lift optimization
